mcqs.question_text: Which of the following are primary functions of DNS? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Resolving domain names to IP addresses
Encrypting data packets for secure transmission
Routing traffic to geographically closest servers (GeoDNS)
Performing user authentication

mcqs.question_text: What does a CDN (Content Delivery Network) do? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Replicates content globally to reduce latency
Ensures secure encryption for all traffic
Delivers content from the nearest server
Develops custom domain names

mcqs.question_text: Which protocols and ports are typically used for web browsing? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: HTTP on port 80
FTP on port 20
HTTPS on port 443
SSH on port 22

mcqs.question_text: Which statements describe the role of IP addresses in networking? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: They provide a unique address for devices on a network
They convert human-readable names to numerical codes
They direct data packets to the correct device destination
They allow for secure encryption of data during transit

mcqs.question_text: Which statements are true about HTTPS? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: It encrypts data between client and server
It uses certificates (SSL/TLS) to establish secure connections
It transmits data in plaintext over port 80
It typically uses port 443 for encrypted traffic

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following are examples of browser storage mechanisms? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Cookies
Local Storage
SSH Keys
Session Storage

mcqs.question_text: Which statements describe static websites? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: They consist of HTML files that do not change unless edited by a developer
They dynamically generate content on the server side
They commonly use only HTML, CSS, and possibly some JavaScript
They require a database for each page load

mcqs.question_text: What is the primary purpose of GeoDNS? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: To encrypt all DNS requests
To resolve domain names in different languages
To route user requests to a server closest to their location
To manage domain registrations

mcqs.question_text: Which items are typical responsibilities of a web server like Apache or Nginx? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Logging and monitoring incoming requests
Serving static or dynamic content to clients
Running client-side JavaScript in the browser
Ensuring data security (HTTPS) and handling certificates
Compiling code from source on the client machine

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following are best practices when deploying a web server? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Enable HTTPS/TLS certificates for secure connections
Allow unrestricted access to all ports for simplicity
Set up logging and monitoring for traffic analysis
Use SSH for remote configuration and server access
Rely exclusively on default usernames/passwords

mcqs.question_text: Which scenarios would you use local storage rather than cookies? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Storing small, sensitive session tokens
Saving larger amounts of data needed across many visits
Storing short-term data that clears on tab close
Preserving user preferences for a site over time

mcqs.question_text: Which tasks are typically part of the backend in modern web development? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Database interactions (CRUD)
Creating RESTful or GraphQL APIs
Handling DNS name resolution
Server-side user authentication
Rendering the final HTML in the browser

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following steps are usually involved in deploying a web server? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Choose a hosting type (Shared, VPS, Dedicated, Cloud)
Write all frontend code in assembly
Install prerequisites (like PHP, Nginx, etc.)
Upload or clone your application code
Use DNS to map IP addresses to MAC addresses

mcqs.question_text: Which statements describe session storage? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Data persists even after the browser is closed
Data is cleared when the tab or window is closed
It's typically used for permanent authentication tokens
It's useful for temporarily holding form data

mcqs.question_text: What are key components of a modern 'full stack' web application? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Database or data storage layer
Front-end (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Remote hardware debugging circuit
Backend (server-side logic and APIs)
In-browser CPU virtualization

mcqs.question_text: Which of these hosting options typically provides the most control over server configuration? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: Shared Hosting
VPS (Virtual Private Server)
Cloud Hosting
Dedicated Server

mcqs.question_text: Which statements accurately describe HTTP? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: It's a request-response protocol used by web browsers and servers
It inherently encrypts all traffic by default
It can carry different data formats (HTML, JSON, binary, etc.)
It is stateless, meaning each request is independent
It only supports GET requests

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following best describe the difference between front-end and back-end? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Front-end focuses on user-facing content rendered in the browser
Back-end focuses on logic, data storage, and server-side processing
Back-end strictly deals with DNS resolution
Front-end can only be written in HTML

mcqs.question_text: Which steps are commonly taken to secure a web server? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Configuring HTTPS with a valid SSL/TLS certificate
Making all server logs publicly accessible
Limiting open ports and using firewalls
Disabling SSH access entirely
Keeping software packages up-to-date

mcqs.question_text: Which statements are true about OAuth and JWT in web applications? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: OAuth allows users to log in via third-party providers (e.g., Google, Facebook)
JWT is typically used to store large files for client download
JWT provides a compact way to send authenticated user data in APIs
OAuth is used only for browser local storage

mcqs.question_text: Which hosting approach is known for 'pay-as-you-go' scalability? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: Shared Hosting
Dedicated Hosting
Cloud Hosting
Local hosting on a personal computer

mcqs.question_text: What distinguishes static websites from dynamic ones? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Static websites rarely change unless modified by developers
Dynamic sites often use server-side scripts and databases
Static sites always require user authentication
Dynamic sites never include JavaScript

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following steps typically occur when you type a URL in your browser and hit Enter? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Browser checks its cache or DNS resolver for the IP address
Browser sends a request to the server on the relevant port (e.g., 80 or 443)
Server compiles the entire operating system kernel
Server sends a response (HTML, JSON, etc.) back to the browser
Browser must always prompt for a username/password first

mcqs.question_text: Which are reasons to enable HTTPS on your website? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: To prevent data from being transmitted in clear text
To speed up DNS name resolution
To provide trust via SSL/TLS certificates
To eliminate the need for a server

mcqs.question_text: Which statements accurately describe cookies? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: They are often used for storing login tokens and user session info
They are restricted to storing at most a few kilobytes
They are cleared automatically when the browser tab closes
They can persist across browser sessions until they expire or are deleted
They cannot be used for authentication data

mcqs.question_text: Which is an example of using OAuth in a web application? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: User logs in to your site using Google credentials
User manually sends an IP address to your DNS server
Server checks localStorage for SSL certificates
Client sends unencrypted password to the server

mcqs.question_text: Which of these are valid ways to access or upload files to a remote server? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Using SSH to securely manage files on a Linux VPS
Using HTTP to manually run shell commands
Using SFTP or FTP to transfer local files to the server
Using domain name to generate random code files

mcqs.question_text: Which examples reflect best practices for server logs? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Storing logs securely (not publicly available)
Analyzing logs for security incidents and performance data
Deleting logs in real-time to save disk space
Archiving older logs for auditing and compliance
Appending logs to the browser local storage

mcqs.question_text: Which statements correctly describe how DNS works? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: It translates domain names to IP addresses
It only serves websites located in the same country
It can route users to different servers based on geographic location
It encrypts all web traffic end-to-end

mcqs.question_text: Which steps are commonly involved in setting up HTTPS for a website? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Generating or obtaining an SSL/TLS certificate
Configuring the web server (Nginx, Apache) to use the certificate
Disabling all DNS records
Redirecting HTTP (port 80) to HTTPS (port 443)
Replacing the server's IP address with the certificate text

mcqs.question_text: Which of these are typical use cases for session storage? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Remembering a multi-step form across tabs for weeks
Temporarily storing unsaved changes for a single browser tab
Keeping user login tokens for persistent sign-in
Managing ephemeral data that resets when the tab closes

mcqs.question_text: Which of these are main goals for deploying a web server? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Making your website or API accessible publicly or privately
Replacing user operating systems with a Linux distro
Configuring a server to respond to HTTP/HTTPS requests
Eliminating the need for domains or DNS

mcqs.question_text: Which statements best describe the difference between 'authentication' and 'authorization'? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Authentication verifies a user's identity
Authorization determines what resources a user can access
Authentication always grants access to every resource
Authorization replaces DNS routing

mcqs.question_text: Which are potential benefits of using a CDN? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Decreased page load times due to closer edge servers
Automatic encryption without certificates
Reduced server load on your origin server
Improved availability if one node fails
Replacing the need for DNS

mcqs.question_text: Which statements are correct about deploying to a VPS (Virtual Private Server)? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: You have root (or sudo) access to configure the environment
You share the exact same operating system instance with hundreds of users
It provides more control than shared hosting but less than a dedicated server
All software updates are automatically handled by the hosting provider

mcqs.question_text: Which are common technologies for building a dynamic backend? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Node.js
Python (Flask, Django)
Nginx (as a standalone back-end language)
Ruby on Rails
DNS over HTTPS (DoH)

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following are typical front-end technologies? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: HTML
CSS
Browser-based JavaScript
SQLite
Linux kernel modules

mcqs.question_text: Which statements accurately characterize cookies vs. local storage? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Cookies are automatically included in server requests (if not blocked)
Local storage data is typically larger in capacity than cookies
Cookies remain after the browser is closed, while local storage is always cleared
Local storage data can never persist between sessions

mcqs.question_text: Which tasks might a developer perform when deploying a web server on cloud hosting? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: Provision a virtual machine or container instance
Use SSH to install software packages (e.g., Node.js, MySQL)
Rely on the cloud provider to exclusively handle domain name purchasing
Configure load balancers or auto-scaling policies
Change localStorage data for every user automatically

mcqs.question_text: Which best describes the primary role of the front-end in web applications? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: Handling server configuration and security patches
Providing the user interface and interactive elements in the browser
Managing database schemas and queries
Encrypting requests via SSL/TLS certificates

mcqs.question_text: Which statements best describe the 'World Wide Web'? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: A global system of interconnected devices and servers that primarily uses HTTP/HTTPS
A fully local network that never communicates beyond a single router
A concept that includes websites, web protocols, and browsers as clients
A protocol solely for transferring email between mail servers

mcqs.question_text: Which HTTP methods are most commonly used in RESTful APIs? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: GET
DELETE
POST
RESOLVE
COPY

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following DNS record types are commonly used for domain resolution? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: A (IPv4 address mapping)
CNAME (Alias to another domain name)
AAAA (IPv6 address mapping)
DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol)
LAN (Local Area Network)

mcqs.question_text: Which command would connect you via SSH to a server with username 'ubuntu' at IP 203.0.113.10 on the default SSH port? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: ssh ubuntu@203.0.113.10
curl ubuntu@203.0.113.10
scp ubuntu@203.0.113.10

mcqs.question_text: Which are examples or benefits of using AJAX for dynamic website interactions? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: It allows partial page updates without reloading the entire page
It absolutely never requires server-side code
It can send and receive data asynchronously in the background
It only works for static HTML websites without any scripting

mcqs.question_text: What is the difference between HTTP PUT and PATCH methods in REST APIs? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: PUT typically replaces the entire resource with a new state
PATCH modifies only specified fields, leaving other parts unchanged
PUT is primarily used for partial updates only
PATCH always deletes the resource before applying new data

mcqs.question_text: Which statements about CDN security or usage are correct? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: A CDN can improve performance by caching content at edge locations
A CDN completely replaces the need for an origin server
A CDN can help mitigate DDoS attacks by distributing traffic
A CDN automatically encrypts all traffic without HTTPS

mcqs.question_text: How are web server logs typically used for troubleshooting or analysis? (3 correct options)

options.option_text: They can be archived or rotated regularly to manage disk space
They are publicly accessible by default for user transparency
They can be parsed by tools to detect errors or security threats
They are never useful for diagnosing complex issues
They can be aggregated across servers for centralized monitoring

mcqs.question_text: Which statement about UML class diagram multiplicities is correct? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: A multiplicity of '1..*' indicates that one instance of a class is associated with many instances of another class, at least one and potentially many.
A multiplicity of '0..1' means at least one instance must always exist on both sides.
'1..1' is invalid syntax in UML for specifying an exact count of one object.
'*..*' means no objects can ever be linked together in the model.

mcqs.question_text: Which actor might be present in a TMS (Traffic Management System) use case to handle accident reporting? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: Traffic Manager, who oversees and responds to real-time accident notifications
AccidentDatabase, an external system providing historical accident data
Traffic Light Hardware, which is part of the same subsystem and not modeled as an actor
Operating System, which is inherently the environment, not an external user

mcqs.question_text: Which of the following might be considered an 'edge case' in TMS operation? (1 correct option)

options.option_text: Multiple accidents occurring at the exact same intersection within a 1-minute window
Normal flow of traffic during morning rush hour
A single accident on a lightly used rural road
Changing signal lights from red to green at 60-second intervals

mcqs.question_text: In the University Library System UML, which detail best demonstrates multiplicity in a class diagram for book borrowing? (2 correct options)

options.option_text: A 'Student' class can be associated with '0..*' borrowed items
A 'Journal' class must always have exactly '1..1' ISSN attribute
A 'Book' class shows each instance can be borrowed by '0..1' student at a time
A 'Librarian' actor with no indicated relationships in the diagram

true_false_questions.question_text: DNS can direct users to different servers based on their geographic location (GeoDNS).
HTTPS transmits data unencrypted over port 443.
HTTP is a stateless request-response protocol.
Cookies are commonly used to store user sessions or login tokens across different visits.
A web server like Apache or Nginx can serve only static HTML files and nothing else.
Local Storage data remains even after the browser is closed, until it’s cleared or overwritten.
A CDN always replaces the need for an origin server.
Session Storage is automatically cleared when the browser tab or window is closed.
OAuth allows users to sign in using existing accounts from providers like Google or Facebook.
DNS translates human-readable domain names into IP addresses.
A Dedicated Server offers more control and resources than shared hosting.
Static websites require a database to generate content dynamically.
HTTPS uses SSL/TLS certificates to encrypt communication between client and server.
GeoDNS is irrelevant for improving performance and latency.
JWT (JSON Web Token) is a common way to securely pass user data in web APIs.
Cloud Hosting typically offers a pay-as-you-go or on-demand billing model.
VPS hosting shares the same OS instance with all users, giving minimal control.
Dynamic websites can change content based on database queries and user interactions.
Web server logs are never useful for debugging or security auditing.
Browser session storage is ideal for data that needs to be permanently preserved after the tab closes.
The World Wide Web refers to a globally connected network of devices and servers communicating primarily over HTTP or HTTPS.
HTTP GET is typically used to retrieve data, while HTTP POST is often used to submit or send data to the server.
Handling multiple simultaneous accidents within the same area is an example of an edge case requirement for the TMS.
In the library system UML example, each Book can be associated with exactly one Student at a time (i.e., one borrower), reflecting a multiplicity of 0..1 from Student to Book.
